##25 million bamboo rats on trial for total fast

Weixin Signal Wowjiemian

Function introduction, the interface news is China has the influence original financial and economic new media, only serves the independent thinking crowd

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Image: Visual China

By Liu Lin

“

Bamboo rat farmers remain hopeful about the future during the crackdown, but the decision to ban all three animals could deal a fatal blow to the industry, which has long been in a gray area.

”

“

Bamboo rat farmers remain hopeful about the future during the crackdown, but the decision to ban all three animals could deal a fatal blow to the industry, which has long been in a gray area.

”

Bamboo Rats, which have gone viral over the past two years, have been shut down since Jan. 21 for "wild animals that might carry COVID-19, " and farmers have been waiting for a month before being hit again.

On February 24, the 16th meeting of the 13th Standing Committee of the National People's Congress passed a decision on comprehensively banning illegal wildlife trade, abolishing the abuse of wild animals and earnestly safeguarding the health and safety of the people, the total prohibition of eating the state protection of "important ecological, scientific, social value of the land wildlife" and other land wildlife, including artificial breeding, artificial breeding of land wildlife.

The bamboo rat is "an important ecological, scientific and social value of the terrestrial wildlife (generally referred to as 'three animals') . ". In 2000, the State Forestry Administration of the People's Republic of China published a list of 1,591 species in the country's protected terrestrial wildlife of either economic or scientific importance, the white bamboo rat, the big bamboo rat, the Chinese bamboo rat and the small bamboo rat are all in it.

####Panic waiting

"there was a lot of wailing, " he said when asked about the first reaction of his bamboo rat-raising friends to the news. "there was no hope. Many people were ready to starve the rats to death slowly and stop investing money. "

Ho Tin Shui is a native of Xinyi in Guangdong Province. Located in the mountainous southwest of Guangdong, Ho Tin Shui is known as the "home of bamboo" . A large quantity of bamboo, together with locally grown sugar cane, is an excellent fodder for bamboo rats. There are many local farmers breeding bamboo rats, he Tianshui alone where the Yifu farmers specialized cooperative breeding bamboo rats have more than 60 breeding households.

In 2014, he Tianshui, who had been working in Shenzhen for more than ten years, decided to breed bamboo rats after a period of hesitation. He started with a few pairs and in 2017 invested 200,000 yuan to build a special farm, which now has more than 600 bamboo rats.

"cast one hundred thousand, in the end bankrupt, " He Tianshui sent a "Alas" word after no reply message.

In recent years, bamboo rat breeding has developed rapidly, especially after the video of bamboo rat led by Huanong brothers became popular on the internet, bamboo rat is in short supply in general. However, the windy bamboo rat industry in the lunar year of the rat Spring Festival sales season has been pressed the pause button.

In an interview with CCTV on the night of January 20, Zhong Nanshan, the head of the COVID-19's high level expert group, said that wild animals such as bamboo rats and badgers were likely to be the source of the outbreak. On the second day of the interview in Zhong Nanshan, the General Administration of Market Supervision, the Ministry of Agriculture and rural areas, and the State Forestry and Grassland Administration jointly issued an emergency notice on strengthening market supervision of wild animals and actively carrying out epidemic prevention and control work, the ban, which was followed by a ban on provinces and cities, "requires that wild animals, such as bamboo rats and badgers, that may carry COVID-19, be kept in isolation in their breeding grounds, and that their spread abroad and transshipment are strictly prohibited. ".

In the process of full control, bamboo rat farmers still have hope for the future, farmers continue to feed bamboo rat, while waiting for the resumption of trade after the outbreak lifted.

Now the ban has escalated from Prohibition of Trade to Prohibition of food consumption, and food is the main outlet of domestic bamboo rat breeding, which is also the fundamental reason for the rapid expansion of the bamboo rat industry in recent years, fasting is equivalent to blocking the distribution channels of the bamboo rat farming industry.

"I don't know what to do next, " Nong Zhenfei, head of the Chinese bamboo rat breeding cooperative in Daman village, Guangxi Province, told interface news, "We're on this scale, ten million per cent of the input, more than 20,000 bamboo rats, all of the feed has to be bought out, and it's all going to cost money. "

Nong Zhenfei entered the industry as early as 2009. "I used to do other business, " he said, "At that time, some people kept bamboo rats. After a year or two, they bought a car and a house, so I went to investigate. The first four years, because of technical difficulties, they basically lost money. He went on to study abroad and started making money in 2014. In 2019, we built a new base of more than 30 Mu with the support of the government. Half of the investment is our own, and half comes from bank loans."

Zhao mining, the head of Wanshun Special Breeding Cooperative in Shaodong County, Hunan Province, is a relatively late entrant. "It's been two years, and I've invested more than 3 million, and I've raised about 2,000 now, " he said simply of the future. "Wait for the announcement. "

####Risk of impoverishment

Farmers facing difficulties like he Tianshui, Nong Zhenfei and Zhao mining are widely distributed in the two lakes, Liangguang, Yungui, Sichuan, Chongqing, Jiangxi and Fujian provinces, especially in poor mountainous areas. Guangxi is one of the main bamboo rat breeding areas in China. Liu Kejun, senior livestock pastor of the Guangxi Animal Husbandry Research Institute, estimates that there are about 100,000 farmers raising bamboo rats in Guangxi alone. The number of bamboo rats raised in the stockade is about 18 million, accounting for 70 percent of the country's total, and the annual output value is conservatively estimated to be over 2.8 billion yuan.

"bamboo rat farming can be developed wherever bamboo, sugar cane, elephant grass and cassava poles can be grown, " Liu told interface news, "because unlike raising pigs and cattle, which require a lot of water to survive and produce, bamboo rat farming is well suited to developing as an industry in water-scarce mountainous areas. "

Zhang Wenming, chairman of Guangxi Jincheng Shuangfeng Agriculture and Animal Husbandry Technology Co. , Ltd. , which provides services to the bamboo rat farming industry, told jiemian.com: "bamboo rat is already a very important special breeding project in the southern mountainous areas to make a fortune. It is a good project for small farmers, poor households or migrant workers returning to their villages. "

Nong Zhenfei told the interface news, raising bamboo rat to the labor force requirements are not high, even if the hands and feet are not convenient, you can also raise. Liu Kejun also said that bamboo rats are very suitable for the development of poor households because they can make use of existing resources to develop ecological breeding. Liu Kejun calculates that poor households can invest 5,000 yuan at first and raise 10 pairs of bamboo rats. By learning and mastering the bamboo rat raising technique and careful management, they can grow to 50 pairs of bamboo rats a year later and make a profit of 10,000 yuan or more in the following year.

Because of this, in the war against poverty, low-input bamboo rat breeding has become the preferred project of the grass-roots governments in southern mountain areas. For example, Shijia village, Shuixi town, Xinyu high-tech zone, Jiangxi Province, provides free seed and seedlings to poor households; Chongqing Wuxi County subsidizes bamboo rat farmers with 500 yuan per pair and 2,500 yuan per household; and Ruili Poverty Alleviation Development in Yunnan Province "rewards instead of subsidies" , each pair of bamboo rats received a subsidy of 100 yuan; the Xiangxi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture organized training on bamboo rat breeding techniques in grass roots rural areas; Zhuping village, Yangping town, Zhenyuan city, Guizhou Province, has set up a professional ecological bamboo rat breeding enterprise with the land of the village committee; Cao Jiang town, Gaozhou, Guangdong Province, has adopted bamboo rat breeding as a key industrial poverty alleviation project, and so on.

Fu Haisheng, a poverty alleviation specialist from Shijia village in Shuixi town of Xinyu, Jiangxi Province, told interface news that there were a large number of poor households raising bamboo rats in the area. In Shijia village alone, there were five more households raising bamboo rats last year. "The mountains are full of bamboo, " he said. "The market is fine, 160 yuan per kilogram. A large bamboo rat can sell for nearly 300 yuan. People who make food around here will order it directly. It's not enough. "

Since 2016, Nong Zhenfei, with the guidance and help of the local government, has led villagers, especially poor villagers, to get rich by raising bamboo rats through "companies + cooperatives + farmers" . By April 2019,72 poor households had been lifted out of poverty, after starting production at the new base in 2019, another 120 poor households joined in January 2020.

However, under the current epidemic situation, these farmers who have been lifted out of poverty may be at risk of returning to poverty. "except for the production line, all other work stops, " Zhang said. "those who do service and do technology basically don't have to work, especially those who do sales. All work stops, and the entire industry's revenue is basically zero in the first quarter. "

When a farmer first learned of his decision to fast, he was quite emotional. "We encouraged him to go back to his hometown to start his own business, get rid of poverty and become rich, " he said. "Now that he has just gotten a little better, he has to go back to poverty once again, or even more. " Nong Zhenfei also believed that the possibility of returning to poverty was very great, because their income is almost entirely based on bamboo rats.

####Gray area

Before the National People's Congress imposed a total ban on wild animals, the Wildlife Protection Law (hereinafter referred to as the Protection Law) prohibited the production and trading of food products made from wild animals and their products under the state's key protection, however, the use of food products made from non-state key protected wild animals and their products with proof of lawful origin is not prohibited; and the Law on protection prohibits the illegal purchase of state key protected wild animals and their products for consumption, however, it does not prohibit the legal purchase of wildlife and products that are not under state key protection for consumption. Bamboo rats and other "three animals" and other ordinary wild animals on land, are not the state's key protected animals.

The widely cited "list of land wildlife that has matured through domestication and breeding for commercial purposes" (54 species, not included in the list of bamboo rats) was drawn up by the Forestry Department in August 2003 on the basis of a joint circular issued by several ministries on adapting to the situation and strictly prohibiting illegal hunting and management of Land Wildlife. When the list was released, it was clearly stated that it had been "released in the first batch" , and later, for unknown reasons, no follow-up action was taken by the relevant administrative authorities.

However, in accordance with Article forty-one of the Protection Law, other measures for the management of wildlife under special state protection shall be formulated by the People's congresses of Provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities directly under the central government or their standing committees. That is to say, bamboo rat and other "three animals" specific how to manage, by the provinces and cities in accordance with the actual situation of their own.

Taking Guangxi as an example, according to the measures for the management, utilization, and transportation of domestication and breeding of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region wild animals, any unit or individual engaged in the domestication and breeding of land wild animals must obtain a license for domestication and breeding of land wild animals, in which domestication and breeding of land wild animals is not a priority protected by the state, the license for domestication and breeding of land wild animals shall be uniformly printed by the Administrative Department of Forestry of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. UNITS, organizations and individuals engaged in the utilization of land wild animals or their products must obtain a license for the utilization of land wild animals and their products issued by the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

According to the actual operation situation of various provinces and cities, if bamboo rat farmers want to legally breed bamboo rats, they need two certificates to be issued by the local Forestry Department: a wild animal domestication and breeding license and a land wild animal management and Utilization License, at the same time there are bamboo rat introduction certificate, the latter by the sale of seedlings, farmers with three certificates issued.

However, not all farmers have these three documents, according to an estimate of one interviewee who did not want to be named, about 30% of all three. Interface News in the interview found that there is no license farmers, some because the cooperative license is complete, some because the demand exceeds supply, direct home purchase will not consider whether the document is complete.

From the farm to the middle of the table, can be said to have been in a gray area. Bamboo rats do not have the same standard standard as the pig industry. Since there are no relevant inspection and quarantine standards, animal husbandry and veterinary departments will not issue quarantine certificates. Therefore, quarantine at the place of origin and slaughter are not available, there is also a lack of effective regulation of intra-provincial or inter-provincial transport. Although the Forestry Department will also be issued taming wild animals transport certificate, but, on the one hand, cumbersome procedures, a longer time, on the other hand, it is also difficult to be recognized by the provincial, especially the railway transport department.

Previously, practitioners of the bamboo rat breeding industry believed that the development of the industry was hampered by the inadequacy of the relevant system, and hoped that captive bamboo rats could be placed under the supervision of the Animal Husbandry Department, then like the traditional livestock and poultry to issue the relevant certification of Animal Epidemic Prevention, to facilitate transport and marketing.

The crux of the matter is the identity of captive bamboo rats, which is why the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress's latest decision has had an impact on the bamboo rat industry.

The current "Wildlife Protection Law" clearly stipulates that "the state shall implement classified protection of Wildlife" , that is, to define and manage wildlife by species. Even domesticated wild animals are classified as wild animals.

Liu Kejun believes that wild bamboo rats can be managed as wild animals, and that captive rats should be managed as poultry and livestock, not as species. Tian Li (not his real name) , who has been raising bamboo rats in Guilin for six years, told interface news, bamboo rats have been bred for countless generations, and those who want to raise bamboo rats are introduced from other farmers, and I don't even know what a wild bamboo rat is, and even if there are bamboo rats nearby, they escape from the farms.

"Most of the bamboo rats on the market today are kept in captivity, " Liu said, "It is undeniable that there will also be a rare phenomenon of selling wild bamboo rats, but the prices of wild bamboo rats will be 15-20% higher. As long as we strictly crack down on the trafficking of wild animals, heavy penalties and publicity, we should be able to stop the illegal activities. "

Still, some experts disagree. Li Jianqiang, a part-time researcher at the Northwest University of Politics and Law, told China business news that a "one-size-fits-all" approach should be taken to the edible wild animal breeding industry. He points out that captive environments will never replicate the natural habitat of wild animals in the wild. Large numbers of wild animals breed, breed, and hoard in confined spaces. Their viruses have the perfect opportunity to cross-infect and mutate.

However, bamboo rat farmers believe that bamboo rat culture is different from other special culture, is a green ecological breeding. Moreover, traditional livestock and poultry have had human diseases, such as avian influenza, have not been completely fasting, not to mention the relationship between bamboo rats and epidemic situation has not been determined.

"The bamboo rat farm is very clean, not as dirty as raising pigs and chickens. Bamboo rats love to be clean, they eat clean, they excrete less, and they push garbage down the air vent, " he said, "I clean the farm every day, and I have to keep an eye out for any damage to bamboo or sugar cane. If it's dirty or bad, bamboo rats will get diarrhea. We also don't dare to use drugs randomly on bamboo rats. They are very sensitive to this. "

He is puzzled by the relationship between the outbreak and bamboo rats. "after 30 years of domestication, so many people have been breeding bamboo rats that if they do carry the virus, they should be the first to get sick from feeding and transporting them, " he said, "But so far, there has not been a single case reported in the bamboo rat enclosure, nor have there been any news reports. "

####I don't know where I'm going

The decision by the National People's Congress to "completely ban food" did not list the names of the animals involved, and a question and answer by the head of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress on the same day seemed to send a softer signal, the person in charge made an exception when it came to correctly understanding the points that need to be grasped in a total ban on eating wild animals, "there are also some animals (such as rabbits and pigeons) that have been farmed for a long time and are technically mature, which have been widely accepted by the people. The resulting output value and employees have a certain scale. Some of them have played an important role in poverty alleviation. According to the provisions of the decision, the animals included in the catalogue of genetic resources of livestock and poultry provided for in the Animal Husbandry Act are also livestock and poultry, and their breeding and utilization, including consumption, are subject to regulation and strict quarantine under the provisions of the Animal Husbandry Act."

The bamboo rat breeding is just play an important role in poverty eradication, the resulting output value and practitioners have a certain scale, in addition, bamboo rat breeding has been recognized and encouraged by government departments at all levels.

The development plan for Poverty Alleviation in the agricultural sector (2011-2020) , published in 2013, clearly proposed the "development of special breeding of water cows, black bone sheep and wild boar, bamboo rat and other special breeding and aquaculture according to local conditions" in the planning of the border areas in western Yunnan. The Gongcheng Yao Autonomous County bamboo rat was certified as a National Geographic Marker for agricultural products in 2014. Among the first batch of livestock, poultry and aquatic products supplied by farmers'co-operatives released by the Ministry of Agriculture and rural areas on February 21,25 are bamboo rats. Local governments at the grass-roots level have also introduced support policies for bamboo rat breeding from the aspects of subsidies, credit, technology and regulations. Bamboo rat breeding to get rich has been widely publicized for many years, such as CCTV seven sets of "daily agricultural classics" , "get rich classics" , "agricultural wide world" and other columns have reported many times on bamboo rat breeding.

" 'like pigeons and rabbits, ' we can have bamboo rats. If we ban special farming, especially bamboo rat farming, more poor households will return to poverty. " Liu said bamboo rats are also "widely accepted by the people" and sales of commercial bamboo rats have been rising over the years. According to incomplete statistics, more than 6 million bamboo rats are consumed in Yunnan, Guizhou, Hunan, Guangxi, Guangdong, Hainan, Fujian, Shanghai, Sichuan, Jiangxi and Hong Kong every year.

Bamboo rat not only in domestic hot sales, in the international market is also very popular. In 2017, the results of the project "investigation on the restrictive factors and countermeasures of bamboo rat farming in Guangxi" , which was co-operated by Guangxi Animal Husbandry Research Institute, Gongcheng Yao Autonomous County Aquatic Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Bureau, and Nanning Jincheng Shuangfeng Agriculture and Animal Husbandry Co. , Ltd. , showed that, while Alaska imports bamboo rat meat from China every year, China exports about 500 tons of bamboo rat meat to Southeast Asian countries every year. A pair of leather shoes made from bamboo rat skin sells for $500-$1,000 on the international market, the price of a top coat of bamboo rat is 2000-3000 US dollars. The bamboo rat needs 40,000 yuan per kilogram. The high-grade brush made of bamboo rat's beard is a traditional export commodity of our country and sells very well in the Japanese market.

He Tianshui, who has a full license, thinks that if he is worried about the possible risks of bamboo rat farming, can it be standardized like the pig industry? "Can we determine the relationship between the bamboo rat and the outbreak as soon as possible, " Zhang said. "If there is no relationship, can we continue to allow artificial breeding and legal marketing under the premise that the outbreak can be prevented and controlled? "

Zhang Wenming is not optimistic about the future. After seeing the regulations that Shenzhen may issue, he estimates that "it is likely to be a one-size-fits-all, after all, domesticating bamboo rats is not as mature as pigs and chickens. ".

On February 21, the Shenzhen People's Congress asked the relevant departments and experts of the municipal government for their opinions on the Draft Regulations on the total prohibition of eating wild animals in the special administrative region. The ordinance will formulate and promulgate the "list of edible animals in the HKSAR" , which clearly stipulates that no person shall consume or organize to consume any animals or products other than the "list" . Of these, only 10 kinds of land animals are edible in the special zone: pigs, cattle, sheep, donkeys, rabbits, chickens, ducks, geese, pigeons, quails.

By February 25, the Shenzhen municipal government had released the draft regulations on the total prohibition of Eating Wild Animals under the Shenzhen Special Economic Zone (draft for comments) , which relaxed the rules for eating wild animals. In addition to the above 10 animals, and added "other poultry and livestock that the city Government of the People's Republic of China has determined can be eaten. " .

In response to a reporter's question, the head of the relevant department of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress said, "The promulgation and implementation of this decision (i.e. a total ban on food consumption) may bring some economic losses to some farmers who raise animals. Relevant local Government of the People's Republic of China shall support, guide and help affected farmers to adjust and change their production and business activities, and provide certain compensation according to the actual situation. "

Nong Zhenfei revealed that Guangxi is statistical information, there may be a follow-up policy.

The head of bamboo rat breeding information platform "Mr. Rhizomys" told interface news that some provinces, such as Hunan and Guangdong, have started to have forestry authorities come to legal breeding farms to issue relevant warning instructions, to prepare the farmers psychologically and to discuss the issue of subsidies for non-hazardous treatment, but in the end no decision has been made for implementation.

"people are waiting for the final announcement of the national policy, " the official said. "Why say 'wait' ? It's because there is no one-size-fits-all concept in the decision on the 24th. From this, we can see that there is still a glimmer of hope. "

In any case, after the outbreak of the disease, wildlife-related law amendment is imperative. The Standing Committee of the National People's Congress has said it will include amendments to the Wildlife Protection Law in its legislative work plan this year, and plans to speed up the process of amending laws such as the Animal Epidemic Prevention Law.

If the bamboo rat breeding industry can continue to exist, various links in the bamboo rat industrial chain need to be rearranged and standardized in an all-round way. Practitioners need to find ways to win back the confidence of consumers, it is also necessary to take preventive measures to avoid falling back into the same trap as this year. The optimistic scenario is that after this outbreak, bamboo rats can be included in the scope of animal quarantine, quarantine regulations issued, further, each bamboo rat can have identification marks, can trace the origin, transportation, trading, sales and other links.

What will happen to the 25 million bamboo rats? Sell or kill? Bamboo rats are still waiting.
